title: Cellar Club Vancouver Final Evening 2014-02-26
description:

The Cellar Club, 3611 West Broadway Vancouver

CBC Radio 1 "Hot Air" programme

After 13 years of presenting world class jazz at his ground level jazz joint on VancouverÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s leafy west side, Cory Weeds said so long to the Cellar, to his many friends, supporters and fans with one final burninÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ show at the venue.

The concert, hosted by Weeds, and led by Cellar stalwart saxophonist Mike Allen featured 10 musicians who have all had a close association with the club.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“We could have sold the night out five times overÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, said Weeds from the stage as a way of underlining how lucky the people inside the club were to make it in that night. CBC Music was there to capture two soulful sets of music that in many ways summed up the sense of community that made Cory WeedsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Cellar Jazz Club an artistic success from the very beginning.

The night kicked off with Ã¢â‚¬Å“Love Walked InÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, a George Gershwin standard that was actually the first tune ever played at the Cellar. And fittingly the recorded portion of the evening concluded with a kickinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ version of Hugh FraserÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s punchy blues, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Thank You Very MuchÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ sung by Jennifer Scott.
